attributes.action: Preserve the history of WW2 Pill Boxes by making councils preserve them
attributes.additional_details: For the preservation of our country's history as we progress into the future
attributes.background: Preserve WW2 and WW1 sites as historic monuments

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Some WW2 pillboxes are already listed buildings, but decisions about whether buildings are listed is a matter for Historic England, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You can find out more about listed building on Historic England's website: https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/what-is-designation/listed-buildings/
